bibl.title: The Medical and Surgical History of the War of the Rebellion. (1861-65.)

taxonomy.bibl: Medical and Surgical History of the War of the Rebellion

keywords.term: ligations of the anterior tibial artery
ball entered external condyle of femur, cut out three inches above

revisionDesc.change: additional proofing of transcription and encoding, identified keyword terms
case text extracted and transformed from larger file
initial checking of OCR text; encoded P5 Encoding

body.p: CASE 1163.—Private A. Shaw, I, 16th Massachusetts, aged 19, wounded May 3, 1863; ball entered external condyle of right femur and was cut out at a point three inches above; hæmorrhage; June 11, ligation of articular branch; admitted into Armory Square Hospital, Washington; discharged December 14, 1863.
